perturbation.original_text: Payment by Bunker One for the Product, as defined in clause 2.1, will be made by wire transfer within three (3) Business Days after the date Vertex invoices Bunker One, to an account desig- nated from time to time by Vertex.
perturbation.changed_text: Payment by Bunker One for the Product, as defined in clause 2.1, will be made by wire transfer within thirty (30) Business Days after the date Vertex invoices Bunker One, to an account designated from time to time by Vertex.
perturbation.explanation: In Alabama, the Prompt Payment Act generally requires payments to be made within 30 days. Modifying the payment term to 30 days could be inconsistent with industry standards and potentially delay payments to Vertex, conflicting with the intended purpose of ensuring timely compensation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The Prompt Payment Act generally requires payments to be made within 30 days.

perturbation.original_text: A Party fails to make, when due, any payment under this JSMA and such failure is not remedied within three (3) Business Days after written notice of such failure is given to the Party;
perturbation.changed_text: A Party fails to make, when due, any payment under this JSMA and such failure is not remedied within one (1) Business Days after written notice of such failure is given to the Party;
perturbation.explanation: Alabama law provides certain rights and remedies to parties in the event of a breach of contract, including reasonable time to cure a default. Reducing the cure period to one business day may be deemed commercially unreasonable and could potentially violate principles of fair dealing and good faith under Alabama contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Alabama contract law principles of fair dealing and good faith, and general legal standards for reasonable cure periods.

perturbation.original_text: The obligation of confidentiality shall be of a continuing nature for 2 years after termination of this JSMA and shall not be canceled by the expiration, suspension or termination of the JSMA.
perturbation.changed_text: The obligation of confidentiality shall be of a continuing nature for 6 months after termination of this JSMA and shall not be canceled by the expiration, suspension or termination of the JSMA.
perturbation.explanation: Alabama's trade secret laws provide protections for confidential business information. Reducing the confidentiality period to 6 months may be insufficient to adequately protect trade secrets or proprietary information, potentially conflicting with the purpose of safeguarding such information under Alabama law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Alabama Trade Secrets Act and common law principles regarding the protection of confidential business information.
